title: Fanny and Alexander
creator_contributor_role: Cinematograph for Svenska Filminstitutet, production company
subject_group: Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Sadism in moving pictures
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Masochism
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Sadism
Family, Gender Identity, Relationships & Sexuality/Sadism in moving pictures
description: An edited version dubbed in English. Told through the eyes of a small boy, this most personal of Bergman's works is both autobiographical and an artistic reference point. Set during the turn-of-the century Sweden, the story is about the well-to-do, loving and ebullient Ekdahl family. When the actor-father of 10 year old Alexander and 8 year old Fanny dies, their mother marries a sadistic minister. His cruelty leads Grandmother Eckdahl's Jewish friend and lover to rescue them. Happiness and balance is restored. Announced as Bergman's final film, it offers a superlative culmination of his 37 years as one of cinema's greatest artists. Oscar Winner 1982 for Best Foreign Language Film, Best Cinematography, Best Art Direction and Best Costume Design. Stars Pernilla Allwin, Bertil Guve, Ewa Froling, Jan Malmsjo, Erland Josephson.
